question.title: Why should I return a Publisher instead of throwing an exception in Spring WebFlux?
question.body:
In Spring WebFlux, when working with reactive streams , why is it recommended to return a Publisher (like Mono.error()) instead of throwing an exception directly within a stream?

I saw this question and the example mentioned in the response but I would like a clear explanation that provides a general understanding of the real problems with throwing exceptions in reactive streams, not just an example.
